sen.j: 櫓（やぐら）とは日本の古代よりの構造物・建造物、または構造などの呼称。
sen.e: "Yagura" (turret), which is written as "櫓" in Japanese, is a term for Japanese traditional constructions, buildings, and structure.
"Yagura" (turret), which is written as "櫓" in Japanese, is a term for Japanese traditional constructions, buildings, and structure.
"Yagura" (turret), which is written as "櫓" in Japanese, is a term for Japanese traditional constructions, buildings, and structure.

sen.j: 矢倉、矢蔵、兵庫などの字も当てられる。
sen.e: This term is also written as "矢倉", "矢蔵", or "兵庫".
This term is also written as "矢倉", "矢蔵", or "兵庫".
This term is also written as "矢倉," "矢蔵," or "兵庫."
sen.cmt: コンマの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 木材などを高く積み上げた仮設や常設の建築物や構造物。
sen.e: Temporary or permanent buildings and constructions made by heaping up lumber.
Temporary or permanent buildings and constructions made by heaping up lumber.
Temporary or permanent buildings and constructions made by heaping up lumber.

sen.j: （見世物小屋や相撲、祭りの太鼓櫓・火の見櫓などの物見櫓等）
sen.e: (such as drum turrets seen at a show tent, a sumo performance, and a festival, and watchtowers including a fire watchtower)
(such as drum turrets seen at a show tent, a sumo performance, and a festival, and watchtowers including a fire watchtower)
(such as drum turrets seen at a show tent, a sumo performance, and a festival, and watchtowers including a fire watchtower.)
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 古代からある城等に建てられた矢を納めた倉庫兼発射台、防衛用の仮設の掘立建物。
sen.e: A building used both as a storehouse for arrows and a launching site which is constructed at an ancient castle, and temporary defense buildings supported by posts sunk directly into the ground.
A building used both as a storehouse for arrows and a launching site which is constructed at an ancient castle, and temporary defense buildings supported by posts sunk directly into the ground.
A building used both as a storehouse for arrows and a launching site which is constructed at an ancient castle, and temporary defense buildings supported by posts sunk directly into the ground.

sen.j: （物見櫓（井楼）など）
sen.e: (such as a watchtower called seiro)
(such as a watchtower called seiro)
(such as a watchtower called seiro)

sen.j: 近世の城郭に建てられた矢や鉄砲を発射するための重層または単層の建造物。
sen.e: A multi story or single story building for firing arrows or guns which is constructed at an early modern castle.
A multi story or single story building for firing arrows or guns which was constructed at an early modern castle.
A multi story or single story building for firing arrows or guns which was constructed at an early modern castle.

sen.j: 構造部位の名称（船櫓・炬燵櫓など）・技の名称（相撲の技・将棋の陣たて）
sen.e: Names of construction parts (such as funa-yagura (a yagura installed on a Japanese-style ship) and kotatsu-yagura (a wooden frame of a kotatsu, a Japanese foot warmer)), and names of techniques or arts (a winning technique of sumo and a battle formation of shogi, a Japanese board game resembling chess).

Names of construction parts (such as funa-yagura (a yagura installed on a Japanese-style ship) and kotatsu-yagura (a wooden frame of a kotatsu, a Japanese foot warmer)), and names of techniques or arts (a winning technique of sumo and a battle formation of shogi, a Japanese board game resembling chess).

sen.cmt: 括弧内括弧を[]に訂正しました。

sen.j: 芝居小屋
sen.e: Theater
Theater
Theater

sen.j: 本格的な芝居小屋では建物正面、入り口の上に櫓を設置するのが通例であった。
sen.e: Orthodox theaters have mostly had a yagura at the front of a building, above the entrance.
Orthodox theaters have mostly had a yagura at the front of the building, above the entrance.
Orthodox theaters have mostly had a yagura at the front of the building, above the entrance.

sen.j: 特に江戸時代までは常設の芝居小屋には認可が必要であり、それを得ている芝居小屋は槍や御幣を飾ってその地位を示した。
sen.e: Theaters required a permission to be permanently built especially until the Edo period, and permitted theaters displayed spears and gohei (a wand tipped with strips of white paper) to show their status.

Theaters required permission to be permanently built especially until the Edo period, and permitted theaters displayed spears and gohei (a wand tipped with strips of white paper) to show their status.

Theaters required permission to be permanently built especially until the Edo period, and permitted theaters displayed spears and gohei (a wand tipped with strips of white paper) to show their status.

sen.j: 明治以降になっても建築様式として引継がれ、伝統的な様式を採用する芝居小屋には櫓が設置される。
sen.e: This style was taken over as an architectural style beginning with the Meiji period, and theaters which adopt a traditional style still have a yagura.
This style was taken over as an architectural style beginning with the Meiji period, and theaters which adopt a traditional style still have a yagura.
This style was taken over as an architectural style beginning with the Meiji period, and theaters which adopt a traditional style still have a yagura.

sen.j: 仮設の櫓
sen.e: Temporary yagura
Temporary yagura
Temporary yagura

sen.j: 祭りや盆踊りなどの会場にするため、広場に塔状の構造物を仮設することがある。
sen.e: A temporary tower-style structure is sometimes set up in a field to be used as a special place for a festival or a Bon Festival Dance.
A temporary tower-style structure is sometimes set up in a field to be used as a special place for a festival or a Bon Festival Dance.
A temporary tower-style structure is sometimes set up in a field to be used as a special place for a festival or a Bon Festival Dance.

sen.j: これも櫓と言う。
sen.e: This is also called yagura.
This is also called yagura.
This is also called yagura.

sen.j: 櫓の上で音楽を演奏したり、櫓と繋いだ縄に飾りつけをして見栄えを整える。
sen.e: People play music on the yagura and make the yagura look more attractive with decorations on some ropes attached to the yagura.
People play music on the yagura and make the yagura look more attractive with decorations on ropes attached to the yagura.
People play music on the yagura and make the yagura look more attractive with decorations on ropes attached to the yagura.

sen.j: 相撲興行の際に、寄せ太鼓（当日の興行実施を知らせる）やはね太鼓（当日興行の終わりを知らせる）をうつために作られる太鼓櫓もこれに含まれる。
sen.e: This type of yagura also includes drum turrets built for yosedaiko (drum beating made on the performance day which announces that the performance is about to begin) and hanedaiko (drum beating made on the performance day which announces that the performance has ended) at a sumo performance.

This type of yagura also includes drum turrets built for yosedaiko (drum beating made on the performance day which announces that the performance is about to begin) and hanedaiko (drum beating made on the performance day which announces that the performance has ended) at a sumo performance.

This type of yagura also includes drum turrets built for yosedaiko (drum beating made on the performance day which announces that the performance is about to begin) and hanedaiko (drum beating made on the performance day which announces that the performance has ended) at a sumo performance.

sen.j: ただし、現在の両国国技館では、安全上の観点から、仮設ではなく常設の太鼓櫓が作られ、エレベーターも備えられている。
sen.e: However, the current drum turret set up at the Ryogoku Kokugikan Arena is the permanent one, not the temporary one, for the security reasons; besides, it has an elevator.
However, the current drum turret set up at the Ryogoku Kokugikan Arena is a permanent one, not a temporary one, for security reasons; besides, it has an elevator.
However, the current drum turret set up at the Ryogoku Kokugikan Arena is a permanent one, not a temporary one, for security reasons; besides, it has an elevator.

sen.j: 火の見櫓
sen.e: Hinomi-yagura (fire watchtower)
Hinomi-yagura (fire watchtower)
Hinomi-yagura (fire watchtower)

sen.j: 現在では、火災が発生したときに人が登って火事現場の位置を確認するとともに、上部に設置された半鐘をたたいて音で火事の発生を知らせるための建物として使われている。
sen.e: When a fire occurs, nowadays, people go up a fire watchtower to check the location of the fire scene, and the watchtower is also used to let other people know the occurrence of the fire by ringing a fire bell which is installed on the top of the watchtower.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When a fire occurs, nowadays, people go up a fire watchtower to check the location of the fire scene, and the watchtower is also used to let other people know the occurrence of the fire by ringing a fire bell which is installed on the top of the watchtower.

When a fire occurs, nowadays, people go up a fire watchtower to check the location of the fire scene, and the watchtower is also used to let other people know the occurrence of the fire by ringing a fire bell which is installed on the top of the watchtower.

sen.j: 防災行政無線のスピーカーの設置塔となっていることも多い。
sen.e: Fire watchtowers often have a loudspeaker for official disaster radio.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Fire watchtowers often have a loudspeaker for official disaster radio.

sen.j: 半鐘櫓と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: They are sometimes called hansho-yagura (fire bell yagura) as well.
They are sometimes called hansho-yagura (fire bell yagura) as well.

sen.e: Yagura in shogi
Yagura in shogi
Yagura in shogi

sen.j: 将棋の囲いには矢倉囲いがある。
sen.e: One of shogi's kakoi (castle, a defense formation to protect the King) styles is called yagura-gakoi (yagura castle).
One of shogi's kakoi (castle, a defense formation to protect the King) styles is called yagura-gakoi (yagura castle).
One of shogi's kakoi (castle, a defense formation to protect the King) styles is called yagura-gakoi (yagura castle).

sen.j: 居飛車戦法で用いられることが多い。
sen.e: This is usually adopted in the ibisha strategy (a strategy in shogi in which the Rook stays around its starting position on the board).
This is usually adopted in the ibisha strategy (a strategy in shogi in which the Rook stays around its starting position on the board).

Tournament bracket

sen.j: トーナメント戦で組み合わせが塔状に伸びていくことから、トーナメント表のことを「やぐら」ともいう。
sen.e: A tournament bracket is also called 'yagura' because the lines indicating pairings form a tower shape.

sen.j: 違い棚
sen.e: Chigai-dana (set of staggered shelves)
Chigai-dana (set of staggered shelves)
Chigai-dana (set of staggered shelves)

sen.j: 書院造の違い棚の種類に「やぐら」がある。
sen.e: Yagura' is one of the chigai-dana types in the shoin-zukuri style (a traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a small alcove).
Yagura' is one of the chigai-dana types in the shoin-zukuri style (a traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a small alcove).

sen.j: 炬燵
sen.e: Kotatsu
Kotatsu
Kotatsu

sen.j: 掘り炬燵や炬燵などの脚を含む布団をかけるための骨組みを「櫓・やぐら」という。
sen.e: A 'yagura' refers to a frame including the legs of a hori-gotatsu (a foot warmer built into a floor) or a kotatsu, on which a kotatsu blanket is spread.
A 'yagura' refers to a frame including the legs of a hori-gotatsu (a foot warmer built into a floor) or a kotatsu, on which a kotatsu blanket is spread.

sen.j: 人間騎馬・人間塔
sen.e: Mock cavalry and human tower
Mock cavalry and human tower
Mock cavalry and human tower

sen.j: 人を乗せる騎馬戦や組体操の組み手のことを「やぐら」ということがある。
sen.e: The term 'yagura' sometimes refers to players who form a base part on which other players ride in a cavalry battle game (in which people riding piggyback on other people try to knock off their opponents' headgear) or coordinated group gymnastics.

sen.e: This term refers to a movable yagura for a siege.

sen.j: 車輪が付けられており、移動しながら攻撃できる。
sen.e: It has wheels so that soldiers can move to other spots to attack.

sen.j: 同様のダシ矢倉（だしやぐら）は城の守備においても造られた。
sen.e: In addition, a similar type of yagura called dashi-yagura (which literally means "overhanging turret", representing a yagura which protrudes from castle walls) was made to defend the castle.

sen.j: 祇園祭（京都府京都市）などの祭典に用いられた「山車（だし）」はこれを利用したものであるという説がある。
sen.e: Some people believe that 'dashi' (festival cars), which are used at the Gion Festival (Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture) and other festivals, utilize this type of yagura.

sen.j: 土木

sen.j: 杭打ち地業の際に杭を打つ装置として、丸太や鋼管などを組んで建てた仮設の構造物を「杭打ちやぐら」という。
sen.e: The term 'kuiuchi-yagura' (a pile-driving tower) refers to a temporary structure which is built by constructing logs and steel pipes, and this is used as a machine to drive in piles at a foundation work.
